intro: Crassula alpestris subsp. alpestris, commonly known as the Alpine Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit and fleshy, bluish-green leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or container planting. Due to its drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and low-maintenance gardens.
